Main Habitats:

Tundra

The tundra is the coldest habitat and sometimes nights can last longer than a month. Animals who habit this harsh enviroment have adapted well to the cold and have some interesting features.

Learn more

Savanna

The savanna is almost entirely covered in grass and it holds many interesting animals. While some have slient approach to their pray and hunt fearsomely, others are pretty united and carring for each other.

Learn more

Rainforest

Nearly 1/4 of medicine ingridients and 40% of the planet oxygen comes from the rainforests. They experience a serious amount of rainfall and hold a variety of species with many unique characteristics.

Learn more

Marine

Since 70% of the earth is covered in oceans, marine habitat is the largest and holds many diffrent and unique species. A part of them is small but poisonous, some are united and others - pretty deadly.

Learn more

Dessert

Quite brutal enviroment. Having both hot days and freezing nights combined with droughts, deserts animals have to be pretty tough and well-adapted to these harsh conditions.

Learn more

Forest

Forest enviroment might no be extreme compated to other habitats, but it still holds many interesting species. Since forests climate is moderate, animals who habit the region need to adapt to 4 seasons.

Learn more

Latest Posts

Arctic Hare

Posted on August 16, 2017

Arctic hares can be found in the North American  tundra. Unlike most of the rabbits, Arctic hare has adapted to the harsh tundra enviroment. For example, it’s fur changes color according to the season – white during the winter (for sunray absorption and snow blending) and gray for the summer.Read More

Puffin

Posted on August 16, 2017

Famous for their colorful bills and adorable look, puffins live mainly in the open ocean but can also be found near the coasts of  Greenland, Iceland, Norway, eastern Canada and some parts of Russia and norhern Britain. It’s estimated that over 50% of the world puffins population lives nearRead More

Meet the penguins

Posted on August 15, 2017

Penguins are classified as birds, but they have adjusted to swimming rather than flying. They are excelent swimmers which helps them catch their pray. It’s common knowledge that penguins inhabit Antarctica but that’s not true about some species. In order to get to know them, here are 12 factsRead More
